title: Poster, "AGI- To Kyo To", 2007
provenance: Jianping He new to Cooper Hewitt, August 2014
description: "TokyoTo." printed vertically in black, in front of a background of frenzied black lines. AGi, TokyoTo. written in upper left corner in unfilled block capital letters.
justification: On the occasion of their annual conference held in Kyoto in 2006, the Alliance Graphique Internationale (AGI) published a book entitled “To Kyo To”, featuring posters designed by 80 international AGI members.&nbsp; Jianping He designed the book, and created this delicately rendered poster to advertise the publication.&nbsp; He used a thin, free-flowing line that scribbles across the page and doubles back on itself to densely fill the space.&nbsp; The central textforms that make up the publication title, “To Kyo To”, are comprised of layers of concentric circles, as if the designer repeated his motions over and over with a ballpoint pen.&nbsp; The forms echo the punctured holes that make up the title on the cover of the publication itself.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "AGI- To Kyo To", 2007. Offset lithograph on paper. Gift of Jianping He. 2014-23-2.
